original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽3.9. Parāmāsagocchaka, Kusalattika
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma  parāmāsagocchaka kusalattika
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In conformity with the ideas, the Triad of the Exposition, the Text of the Conditions in Triads🔽The sphere of adherence, the Triad of the Wholesome

original: 3.9.1. Parāmāsaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: parāmāsaduka kusalattika
translated: The dyad of adherence, the Triad of the Wholesome

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Noparāmāsaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noparāmāso kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na uparāmāsam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na uparāmāsaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome idea that is not an adherence as condition there arises an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With a cause as condition, one. With an object as condition, one. … With an absence as condition, one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the case of the conascence, … etc., and the questions, in each case there is one.)

original: Parāmāsaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noparāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: parāmāsam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome idea that is an adherence as condition there arises an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence.

original: Noparāmāsaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noparāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na uparāmāsam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na uparāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence as condition there arises an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence. … three.

original: Parāmāsaṁ akusalañca noparāmāsaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca noparāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmāsam akusalañca no parāmāsam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca no parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome idea that is an adherence and an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence as condition there arises an unwholesome idea that is not an adherence. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With a cause as condition, five. With an object as condition, five. … With an absence as condition, five. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā pañca, napurejāte pañca, napacchājāte pañca …pe… nakamme🔽tīṇi …pe… navippayutte pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Noparāmāso akusalo dhammo noparāmāsassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye pañca,
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā pañca na purejāte pañca na pacchājāte pañca pe na kamme  tīṇi pe na vippayutte pañca saṅkhitta sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi  na uparāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na uparāmāsassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye pañca
translated: With non-cause as condition, one … With non-decisive support as condition, five … With non-prior … With non-rebirth … With non-death … With non-change-of-state … With non-disappearance … With non-kamma as condition, three … With non-result as condition, one … With non-nutritive-essence as condition, one. (In brief.) (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)🔽An unwholesome unprompted state is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome unprompted state. (In brief.)🔽With cause as condition, three … With object as condition, nine … With decisive support as condition, nine … With co-nascence, nine … With mutuality, nine … With support, five …

original: upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte pañca …pe…🔽avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)

original: Parāmaṭṭhaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)🔽With an unwholesome root as condition, a wholesome thought arises, a resultant thought, an unwholesome thought, a functional thought.

original: Parāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Aparāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aparāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: parāmaṭṭham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  aparāmaṭṭham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca aparāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a functional root as condition, a functional thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and a functional root as condition, a wholesome thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant thought arises.

original: Parāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākatañca aparāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavārampi …pe… pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmaṭṭham abyākatam ca aparāmaṭṭham abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta sahajāta vārampi pe pañhā vārampi vitthāretabba
translated: With a wholesome root and a functional root as condition, an unwholesome thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and a functional root as condition, a functional thought arises.

original: 3.9.3. Parāmāsasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika🔽Hetu
analyzed: kusala ttika  hetu
translated: With an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, an unwholesome thought arises.🔽With an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a functional thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, an unwholesome thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a functional thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a wholesome thought arises.

original: Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmāsa vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant thought arises.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant and a functional thought arise.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a wholesome and a functional thought arise.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant and a wholesome and a functional thought arise.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant and an unwholesome and a functional thought arise.🔽With a wholesome root and an unwholesome root and a functional root as condition, a resultant and a wholesome and an unwholesome and a functional thought arise.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Parāmāsasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve (sabbattha dve) …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā dve (sabbattha dve) …pe… navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  parāmāsa sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  parāmāsa vippayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve sabbattha dve pe avigate dve  na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā dve sabbattha dve pe na vippayutte dve saṅkhitta sahajāta vāropi pe sampayutta vāropi vitthāretabbā
translated: As condition, one … As object, one … As an overlord, one … As support, one … As a basis, one … As a foundation, one … As a source, one … As a birthplace, one … As a nurse, one … As a guardian, one … As a resort, one … As a destination, one … As a condition for the arising of the unarisen enlightenment factor of equanimity is a condition, as object condition.🔽(In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., and in the question section, too, all should be treated in the same way as above.)🔽A state unaccompanied by lust that is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state accompanied by lust …🔽A state unaccompanied by lust that is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state unaccompanied by lust …🔽As root-cause, two … As object, two … As an overlord, two … As support, two … As a basis, two … As a foundation, two … As a source, two … As a birthplace, two … As a nurse, two … As a guardian, two … As a resort, two … As a destination, two … As a condition for the arising of the unarisen enlightenment factor of equanimity is a condition, as object condition.🔽(In brief.)🔽As non-root-cause, one … As non-overlord, two … As non-support, two … As non-basis, two … As non-foundation, two … As non-source, two … As non-birthplace, two … As non-nurse, two … As non-guardian, two … As non-resort, two … As non-destination, two … As a condition, other than as root-cause condition, for the arising of the unarisen enlightenment factor of equanimity is a condition, as object condition.🔽(In brief.)🔽As non-root-cause, one … As non-predominance, two … As non-support, two … As non-decisive-support, two … As non-conascence, two … As non-mutuality, two … As non-possession, two … As non-deprivation, two … As non-restraint, two … As non-non-restraint, two … As non-result, two … As non-nutriment, two … As non-kamma, two …

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: (From the root cause, one; from object, one; … from non-hindrance, one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, in each case one.)

original: Parāmāsañceva parāmaṭṭhañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: parāmāsam ca iva parāmaṭṭham ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: An unwholesome consciousness element that is a condition by way of decisive support condition and is a proximate cause arises in dependence on an unwholesome consciousness element that is a proximate cause but is not a condition by way of decisive support condition. … (One.)

original: Parāmaṭṭhañceva no ca parāmāsaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Parāmāsañceva parāmaṭṭhaṁ akusalañca parāmaṭṭhañceva no ca parāmāsaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ
analyzed: parāmaṭṭham ca iva no ca parāmāsam akusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  parāmāsam ca iva parāmaṭṭham akusalam ca parāmaṭṭham ca iva no ca parāmāsam akusalam ca dhamma
translated: An unwholesome consciousness element that is a proximate cause but is not a condition by way of decisive support condition arises in dependence on a wholesome consciousness element that is a proximate cause but is not a condition by way of decisive support condition. … (Three.)

original: paṭicca parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: An unwholesome consciousness element that is a proximate cause but is not a condition by way of decisive support condition arises in dependence on an unwholesome consciousness element that is a proximate cause but is not a condition by way of decisive support condition. … (One.) (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: As condition for five faculties, for five formless constituents, for the element of mental factors, for the element of the mental body, for the element of mental consciousness. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi
translated: (The section beginning “with the connected” should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: Parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso akusalo dhammo parāmaṭṭhassa ceva no ca parāmāsassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmaṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo parāmaṭṭhassa ca iva no ca parāmāsassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome state that is clung to but is not a clinging is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is clung to but is not a clinging. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta
translated: As root-cause condition for three, as object condition for nine, as predominance condition for nine … (and so on as in Section 2 up to) as non-disappearance condition for five. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the section on the wholesome triad, the questions in the method of direct application, reverse application, direct and reverse application, and reverse and direct application should be calculated.)

original: Parāmaṭṭhañceva no ca parāmāsaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmaṭṭham ca iva no ca parāmāsam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca parāmaṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A conditionally-arisen, unwholesome state that is clung to but is not a clinging is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a conditionally-arisen, unwholesome state that is clung to but is not a clinging. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.9.5. Parāmāsavippayuttaparāmaṭṭhaduka, Kusalattika🔽Hetu🔽Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto parāmaṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka           hetu  parāmāsa vippayuttam parāmaṭṭham kusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ parāmaṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … with root-cause as condition … with object as condition … with non-adversion as condition … (In detail as in the chapter on the unwholesome, but with the wholesome instead of the unwholesome.)🔽(In the section on the conascent, etc., and in the question section, there is one triad in each section.)🔽3.9.5. The pair of dyads: not connected with grasping, connected with grasping, etc.🔽The wholesome triad🔽A wholesome, not-grasped, unconnected, phenomenon arises with a wholesome, not-grasped, unconnected, phenomenon as its condition.

original: Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ aparāmaṭṭhaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto aparāmaṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto parāmaṭṭho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: parāmāsa vippayuttam aparāmaṭṭham kusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ aparāmaṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta 🔽hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve 🔽parāmāsa vippayuttam parāmaṭṭham akusalam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ parāmaṭṭhaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: … as object … … without root-cause … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dyad … … in the non-causative action triad … … in the non-causative action dy

original: Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto parāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: parāmāsa vippayuttam parāmaṭṭham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ parāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to, a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to arises, originated by way of condition through a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to.

original: Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ aparāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto aparāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Parāmāsavippayuttaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākatañca parāmāsavippayuttaṁ aparāmaṭṭhaṁ abyākatañca
analyzed: parāmāsa vippayuttam aparāmaṭṭham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ aparāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  parāmāsa vippayuttam parāmaṭṭham abyākatam ca parāmāsa vippayuttam a parāmaṭṭham abyākatam ca
translated: With an object that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to, a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to arises, originated by way of condition through a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to. … three.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca parāmāsavippayutto parāmaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ parāmaṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to, a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to arises, originated by way of condition through a state that is unconnected with grasping and is not clung-to. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Parāmāsagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe avigate pañca 🔽parāmāsa gocchaka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: With a cause, five; with an object, two; … with a nutriment, one; … with a condition, five.🔽The third section for recitation on the skill in the aggregates, etc. connected with the ideas connected with grasping is finished.
